  • Method Details

    • getAllProducts

      List<Product> getAllProducts()
      Fetches all products present in the database.
      Returns:
      a list containing all products, or an empty list if none exist.

    • getProductById

      Product getProductById(Long productId)
      Retrieves a particular product based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product
      Returns:
      the corresponding product object or null if it doesn't exist.

    • addProduct

      Long addProduct(Product product)
      Adds a new product entry to the database.
      Parameters:
      product - the product object to be added
      Returns:
      the ID assigned to the newly created product or null if the operation fails.

    • updateProduct

      boolean updateProduct(Long productId, Product product)
      Updates details of an existing product in the database.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product to be updated
      product - the product object containing updated details
      Returns:
      true if the operation succeeds, false otherwise.

    • deleteProduct

      boolean deleteProduct(Long productId)
      Deletes a product entry from the database based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if the product was deleted successfully, false otherwise.

    • getProductsByDesigner

      List<Product> getProductsByDesigner(Long designerId)
      Fetches all products associated with a specific designer.
      Parameters:
      designerId - the unique identifier for the designer
      Returns:
      a list of products related to the given designer or an empty list if none found.

    • getProductsByCategory

      List<Product> getProductsByCategory(Long categoryId)
      Retrieves all products under a specific category.
      Parameters:
      categoryId - the unique identifier for the category
      Returns:
      a list of products under the given category or an empty list if none found.

    • associateDesignerWithProduct

      void associateDesignerWithProduct(Long designerId, Long productId)
      Associates a designer with a product, indicating that the designer has designed the product.
      Parameters:
      designerId - the unique identifier for the designer
      productId - the unique identifier for the product

    • dissociateDesignerFromProduct

      void dissociateDesignerFromProduct(Long designerId, Long productId)
      Removes the association between a designer and a product.
      Parameters:
      designerId - the unique identifier for the designer
      productId - the unique identifier for the product

    • getDesignersForProduct

      List<Designer> getDesignersForProduct(Long productId)
      Fetches all designers associated with a particular product.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product
      Returns:
      a list of designers who have designed the given product.

    • setProductPopularityForTrend

      void setProductPopularityForTrend(Long productId, Long trendId, int score)
      Sets a popularity score for a product for a specific trend.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product
      trendId - the unique identifier for the trend
      score - the popularity score to be set

    • getProductPopularityForTrend

      Integer getProductPopularityForTrend(Long productId, Long trendId)
      Fetches the popularity score of a product for a particular trend.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product
      trendId - the unique identifier for the trend
      Returns:
      the popularity score of the product for the given trend.

    • getAllProductPopularities

      List<Integer> getAllProductPopularities(Long productId)
      Retrieves all popularity scores for a specific product.
      Parameters:
      productId - the unique identifier for the product
      Returns:
      a list of all popularity scores for the given product across different trends.

    • getProductCountByCategory

      Map<String,Integer> getProductCountByCategory()
      Retrieves a map representing the count of products for each category.
      Returns:
      A map where the keys are category names (or identifiers) and the values are counts of products within that category.
